definition: to relieve oneself (i.e. use the toilet)/to solve
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Part of me wished I'd just discovered it myself as I stood up and grabbed my coat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望當我解手後穿衣服的時候正好發現它的。

sentences.english: Men squatted in the fields, relieving themselves.
sentences.chinese: 戰士們在田野裏蹲着解手。

sentences.english: And Sichuan people still use this term today.
sentences.chinese: 川人至今也稱去廁所爲解手。

definition: to defecate (euphemism)/to go to the toilet
to pass water/to piss/to urinate/to wee wee
to need to answer the call of nature
to pee pee (kiddie or feminine slang)
(jocularly) to need to answer the call of nature
